column4: ï»¿I have a dvd playing on my laptop, but after about a minute of me not using it and letting it just play the sound and video starts jittering very badly, HELP!
with all dvd's?
actually with any media
how do you kniow it isnt the drive?
when i leave the machine alone for a little bit, it seems to want to go into a sleeping mode
so set the power management
i dont know what to set in power managerment
its not like the screen is dimming or something, its that the machine seems to want to scale down its processing
you need to set the standby settings
where would that be?
in the system setting but to be more specific I dotn knopw
i dont know if thats my issue, i dunno if i have ever set anything like that
no time to learn but the present
dont think thats the issue though, any other suggestions?
well it coudl be a time base issue
please explain
have a friend cut a cd with a pure sine wave on it see if the freq changes
i could do that, but it sounds ridiculous
haha
lets say that the frequency does change, what would be the next step?
then it woudl usually be a bad drive
